alert.note: Alert for Blaine (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 9:59AM MDT until further notice by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River near Harlem affecting Blaine County. For the Milk River...including Harlem...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Milk River near Harlem. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM MDT Friday the stage was 23.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 AM MDT Friday was 23.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.3 feet this afternoon and then hold steady for the next couple of days. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.5 feet on 06/11/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued as needed or before this evening at 1000 PM MDT.
